TopicTitle: You must use the object that is in your left hand to survive a thermonuclear war

Articles.Content:
I will begin.

Six inch titanium plated desk.

The radiation seeps in from the screw-holes. Slow and painful.

...A Laptop...

Well, I can use it to find suitable places to visit that haven\'t been yet destroyed by radiation.
Lappy. Google \'How to survive a thermonuclear war\'.

My shirt.

Damn.

A tooth.

Well... I guess I could purchase a shelter with it.
A draw cord in my sweatpants. At least they wont fall down!

A cordless home phone with about five minutes of battery life left...

I guess I\'ll say goodbye to my parents. :\'(
Some paper. DIE ALPHA RAYS ;P!

Deleted

Edited April 24, 2023 by BSOM180

My glasses.

Well, I can see the bomb coming...

A smartphone with full battery.

Looks like I can delete the post. (Horrible RP references activate!)
A magic wand that makes the nukes go away

A pillow.

Crap.
An iPad, this isn\'t going to end well.
A jar full of old bottle caps. I\'M RICH, BABY!

Have to select from the left, then.

Dang, cause to my right I got knives, $60, and books, even walkie-talkies...

Well, on my left I got a neckerchief, a journal, a tracphone, a toy, a kindle, a handbook, a dice, and a comb.

I\'ll just watch the flash, to bad I don\'t even have sunglasses.

At least all you other guys had a pillow to keep you comfy, or journals \'n toys to keep you happy!

I was holding onto my foot...
A card for a free trip to New Mexico. If I\'m gonna die, I\'ll die fighting.

My dog.

Well, dogs can sense the earthquake caused by a thermonuclear explosion, so it can alert me and I can get to a bunker...

--------------

Edited August 1, 2018 by flying_chair

My leg....

LEG IT!
Dang, My shorts... That won\'t help.

My sock...

I suppose I can kill myself thus preventing the thermonuclear war from killing me.
My laptop. It will run out of batteries within 2 hours of the bombs\' fall and thereafter become a particularly bulky paperweight.

Paint. (The kind that used to have lead in it. Was throwing it out.)

Radiation shielding, followed by death without wearing a mask to block lead.
